Job Description:
Corporate Planning leads financial planning and analysis activities across American Express and builds associated capabilities. The Capability Development team is a part of CP&A and serves as an essential business partner of the Enterprise to drive efficiency and value for Investment Optimization processes and capabilities across the Enterprise. The team plays a critical role in defining the strategy for managing investment optimization  at an Enterprise level, evaluating capacity and prioritization based on business needs and driving ongoing enhancements through data, technology and people.
 
As the Product owner of the Planning Analytics (TM1) Technology Platform for Investment Optimization, this position will play an important role in defining a multi-year roadmap for AXP Investment Optimization. This role will partner with a broad set of internal IO stakeholders to deliver against core needs while developing new and innovative IO solutions. 
 
The role will have significant interaction with Finance colleagues and partners across the Enterprise and is a highly visible role with frequent exposure to senior leaders. As such, the ideal candidate must possess not only stellar analytical acumen, but also excellent communication skills.
 
Roles & Responsibilities:

Core Investment Optimization Product Owner responsibilities
Provide strategic and innovative thought leadership with an ability to develop multi-year roadmaps for IO
Partner with stakeholders across Finance, Marketing and the TM1 Development team to understand IO user needs and design and document functional requirements
Coordination with development resources for delivering prioritized capabilities and features
Lead a team that designs new financial models and other enhancements on the enterprise wide TM1 investment platform that is used to optimize billions of dollars of investments
Conduct strategic analyses to develop insights and enhance value and transform IO methodologies
Lead and inspire an engaged team of 4-5 professionals, that will provide strategic and product development support
Develop and present findings and transformation work to senior leaders and interface with partners at all levels in the organization


Excellent analytical abilities, strong written and spoken communication skills, ability to manage multiple priorities effectively with a record of driving results effectively.
Strong relationship and collaboration skills, including the ability to work in a highly Matrix environment across marketing, finance and development.


Ability to challenge the status quo and drive efficiency in processes and decision making
Strong organizational and project management skills, ability to influence without authority
Familiar with Agile development concepts 
Minimum 5 years of Experience- Master’s degree in Accounting/Finance or equivalent preferred
Knowledge of IO, financial planning and reporting processes - Proficient with discounted cash flow models and P&L modeling; experience with investment optimization processes preferred
Thorough knowledge of card business model and associated economics preferred
Ability to adapt effectively in a changing environment and comfortable in dealing with ambiguity
